result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 1:47 PM Defendant William D Flowers Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney William Ginsberg in court for William D Flowers Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin. Argument by Defn. State objects, argument by State. CT denies motion. ALL CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.
Bail/bond hearing on October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defn
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Defn

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 12

8:53 AM Defendant William D Flowers Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney William Ginsberg in court for William D Flowers Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Trisha L Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. State moves for cts 1 and 2 to be found transitionally related. No objection by Defn. CT finds that cts 1 and 2 are transitionally related. Dane County Sheriff Detective Sgt R. B., duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by ADA Simmons. Venue established. Witness identification. Cross Exam by Atty Ginsberg. Witness excused. State moves for bind over, waived argument, reserve rebuttal. Defn objected to bind over, waived argument. CT found PC this defn committed a felony and bound over to branch 12.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on November 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

11:26 AM   DE retained counsel, court will set for prelim, good cause previously found.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Status conference on August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:16 AM Defendant in court, in custody.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn advised he applied w/ SPD and qualifies. Court explained the process to the defn.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
Defn had previously indicated he wanted to hire private atty but now wants SPD; court notified SPD by email and they will see him on 7-1-22 at the jail; Ct finds good cause to go beyond time limits; bail continued
Status conference on June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:21 AM Defendant in court, in custody.  Attorney Timothy Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing scheduled for today.  Defn indicates SPD said they were going to appt atty for him but haven't; however, information rec'd by Ct from SPD indicated Defn planned on hiring private atty.  Discn on record.  Ct will schedule for STC to allow Defn time to hire atty or contact SPD again regarding public defender appt.
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.  **RESCHEDULED AS STC**
Preliminary hearing on June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any co-defendant in this case. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 12

02:33 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Shaun W O'Connell.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
